result.title: Aflac: Is The Premium Valuation Justified Following Its Q3 2025 Earnings?
result.text: Aflac Incorporated continues to face weak growth prospects, with declining revenues in Japan and volatile earnings due to significant forex exposure. AFL's Q3 2025 results showed improved EPS from investment gains, but overall 9M 2025 net earnings fell 36% year-over-year, and reported ROE dropped to 11%. Despite strong capital returns via buybacks and 43 years of dividend growth, AFL's 2.1% yield lags peers, making it less attractive for income investors.

result.title: American workforce burnout reaches 6-year high
result.text: 15th annual Aflac WorkForces Report uncovers highest prevalence of stress among African Americans and younger generations COLUMBUS, Ga. , Oct. 9, 2025 /PRNewswire/ --Burnout among Americans in the workplace has escalated to a six-year high, according to the 15th annual Aflac WorkForces Report 1released by Aflac Incorporated, a leading provider of supplemental health insurance and products in the U.S.2 The report tracks the state of the American workplace among employees and employers  shining the light on trends, attitudes, needs and experiences in health care and benefits administration.
